The feeling of sadness and loss after a fire or other disaster that destroys homes and lives.
Feeling angry and frustrated after being stuck in traffic on a hot day, or after dealing with broken air conditioning.
It can be surprising how quickly the temperature can change during a heatwave, and how it can impact our health and well-being.
The smell of sweat and sunscreen during a hot summer day, or the aroma of cooking food on a hot stove.
The physical sensation of warmth and discomfort when standing in direct sunlight, or the relief of jumping into a cool swimming pool.
The connection to nature that comes from experiencing the beauty and power of the sun, and the shared experience of trying to beat the heat with friends and family.
